img.alt: In accordance with the order issued by the Governor, all schools will remain closed until for the remainder of the school year. We will resume our Flexible Learning Plan on Monday, April 20, 2020.
img.title: In accordance with the order issued by the Governor, all schools will remain closed until for the remainder of the school year. We will resume our Flexible Learning Plan on Monday, April 20, 2020.

img.alt: It is with great sadness that we announce the passing of our beloved Hardin-Jefferson High School Band Director, Mr. Mike Westbrook. Mike was a talented musician that led the Big Blue Machine for 13 years and served public education for 29 years. He was known for his jolly demeanor and was always ready to tell a good joke. He had worked tirelessly to revive our music program at HJ and had accomplished much success on the field and stage. He was always an advocate for the students. Mike was not afraid to speak his mind when it came to giving his students the best learning environment possible. He set high expectations for his students but gave them endless encouragement to guide them in their pursuit. Mike graced not only the HJ community but our surrounding communities with his musical talents. He participated on many stages as an articulate trumpet player with many local bands and orchestras. Mike loved his fellow musicians. He was a devoted husband and father. The entire HJ community is heartbroken, especially Mike's students. We ask that you give his family the privacy they need, and please keep them in your prayers.
img.title: It is with great sadness that we announce the passing of our beloved Hardin-Jefferson High School Band Director, Mr. Mike Westbrook. Mike was a talented musician that led the Big Blue Machine for 13 years and served public education for 29 years. He was known for his jolly demeanor and was always ready to tell a good joke. He had worked tirelessly to revive our music program at HJ and had accomplished much success on the field and stage. He was always an advocate for the students. Mike was not afraid to speak his mind when it came to giving his students the best learning environment possible. He set high expectations for his students but gave them endless encouragement to guide them in their pursuit. Mike graced not only the HJ community but our surrounding communities with his musical talents. He participated on many stages as an articulate trumpet player with many local bands and orchestras. Mike loved his fellow musicians. He was a devoted husband and father. The entire HJ community is heartbroken, especially Mike's students. We ask that you give his family the privacy they need, and please keep them in your prayers.
